description: Borrowed from Japanese 武士道 (bushidō), from Middle Chinese 武士 (mɨoX d͡ʒɨX, “warrior”) + 道 (dɑuX, “way”). Cognate with Mandarin 武士 (wǔshì), Cantonese 武士 (mou5 si6).

entries.meaning: An ethical code of the samurai that was prevalent in feudal Japan that advocated unquestioning loyalty to the master at all costs and obedience in all deeds, valuing honor above life.
